intro: Alyxia obovatifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaf alyxia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other ornamental plants. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves that are often hairy, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its showy, fragrant flowers are typically yellow or orange and bloom in clusters. Alyxia obovatifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adaptable to a variety of growing conditions.
